snippet: Michael Dunn was convicted of first-degree murder in the shooting of an unarmed black teenager after a confrontation over rap music blaring from a car.
abstract: Michael Dunn, who shot unarmed black teenager Jordan Davis to death in Jacksonville, Fla, in February during a dispute over loud music blaring from Davis's car, is convicted of first-degree murder; jury rejects his claim that he fired his gun repeatedly in self-defense; Dunn faces life in prison with no parole.
lead_paragraph: Michael Dunn was convicted of first-degree murder in the shooting of an unarmed black teenager after a confrontation over rap music blaring from a car.

headline.main: Florida Man Is Convicted of Murdering Teenager in Dispute Over Loud Music
headline.print_headline: Florida Man Is Convicted of Murdering Teenager
